data.title: Charlton Heston
data.meta_description: Charlton Heston, who appeared in some 100 films in his 60-year acting career but who is remembered chiefly for his monumental, jut-jawed portrayals of Moses, Ben-Hur and Michelangelo, died April 5, 2008, at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 84, according to his family. Above, Mr. Heston in the film "The Agony and the Ecstasy." (Read the obituary.)
